title: Ellis Island Part of Statue of Liberty National Monument: Photos & Multimedia
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia             Photos & Multimedia       Twitter | Flickr | Oral Histories | Virtual Tour        The story of Ellis Island is the story of people - millions of immigrants - who passed through its halls seeking new opportunities and freedoms. Join us as we tell the story of this place and these people through our photo collections. These images - some historic, some more recent - show us Ellis Island's history, even up to the present-day. Click on an image to view the Flickr collection.NPS Photo, NPS Photo, Library of Congress,NPS Photo, NPS Photo, NPS Photo                        Groundswell On May 17, 2015, the National Park Service and Groundswell Community Mural Project, New York City’s leading organization dedicated to community public art, unveiled a six-panel mural on Ellis Island. Twenty-three teen artists created the new exhibit, which explores the concept of the American Dream, the immigrant identity of the early 20th century, and the issues facing American immigrants today.                  Process to become an American Today               Immigrant being processed, Ellis Island               Notions of the American Dream Today               Historical Notion of the American Dream
